meanings.definition: A person who uses a rope.
meanings.sent1: The ropers at the rodeo were skilled with their lassos.
meanings.sent2: The ranch always had a few ropers to help with the cattle.
meanings.sent3: The ropers decided to have a tug-of-war using their ropes.
meanings.sent4: She was a master roper, always finding a way to lasso anything in sight.
meanings.sent5: The image of the ropers swinging their ropes was etched in his memory.

meanings.definition: A type of shoe with a low heel.
meanings.sent1: Her new ropers were comfortable for walking long distances.
meanings.sent2: The store had a variety of ropers in different colors.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally stepped on her foot with his heavy ropers.
meanings.sent4: The ropers clicked on the wooden floor as she walked down the hallway.
meanings.sent5: The cowboy boots with low heels were known as ropers in the western town.

meanings.sent1: The ropers rode into town on their horses, ready for the rodeo.
meanings.sent2: The old saloon was filled with rowdy ropers enjoying a drink.
meanings.sent3: The ropers challenged each other to a friendly roping competition.
meanings.sent4: He was known as the fastest roper in the west, earning the title of top roper.
meanings.sent5: The ropers wore their cowboy hats proudly as they herded the cattle.
